title: Michael Owen admits he heads to the bar at midday every day when he's on holiday
text:

Former Liverpool and Manchester United striker Michael Owen has admitted he heads to the bar at midday every day when he's on holiday.

The ex-England ace was known for his lethal pace and finishing during a career that saw him win 89 international caps, scoring 40 goals for his country.

Owen scored 163 goals in 362 appearances playing for Liverpool, Real Madrid , Newcastle United, Manchester United and Stoke City in a career that spanned 17 years.

Now 39, he says he is still "annoyingly restless" and spends his mornings playing with the children on the family's annual trips to Dubai.

But by noon he's propping up the bar - and said he stays there for five or six hours.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

“I’m annoyingly restless," said Owen in quotes reported by the Daily Star.

"When we’re in Dubai there are quite a lot of people who are there every year and it’s become a bit of a standing joke.

“For me, there’s nothing better than an active morning, playing with the kids in the pool.

“Then, as soon as it’s midday, you’ll find me at the bar, talking to people until 5pm or 6pm.”

(Image: Daily Mirror)

Owen was involved in a Twitter spat with former England teammate Alan Shearer last month after extracts of his autobiography, Reboot, were serialised in the Mirror.

Shearer was Newcastle manager for eight games during Owen's ill-fated time at the club.

Owen suggested that Shearer blamed him for Newcastle's relegation that season and criticised him behind his back after the club went down.

But Shearer responded on Twitter in brutal fashion .

(Image: Offside)

The Match of the Day pundit posted a video of Owen saying: "So all I did for six, seven years... I hated it, I couldn't wait to retire."

Alongside the video Shearer added the caption: "Yes Michael, we thought that also, whilst on £120k a week..."

But Owen immediately hit back at his former England captain, questioning Shearer's commitment to his boyhood club.

"Not sure you are as loyal to Newcastle as you make out mate," Owen said. "I distinctly remember you being inches away from signing for Liverpool after Sir Bobby Robson put you on the bench. You tried everything to get out."
description: Former Liverpool and Man Utd striker says he spends mornings in Dubai swimming with the kids - then props up the bar
